author: Ian Bowers
comment: so far I'm liking it, but a "mark all as read" option from the watch app itself would be great.  And a "show only the most recent 20/40/50/etc tweets" function would be cool as well.   when I see "246 unread tweets" I just dismiss it since I know there's no way I'm scrolling through all that.
title: pretty good!

author: Brett Besa
comment: The icon really needs to be different and I'd like the app icon to hide from the drawer since it doesn't have any options. And maybe consider using profile pictures for the backgrounds when swiping through. But really those are just small tweaks, you've got a really good app here overall!
title: Keep going!

author: Cory Cone
comment: Can you add a "Mark all tweets read" button in the notification next to "Open"? Also dates and times on the tweets would be great. Great work Dev!
title: Great app!

author: Frank Krieger
comment: This. This does exactly what I want my watch to do, display tweets. Works great!
title: One of the Better Android Wear Apps

title: Broken

author: Caleb Schlossin
comment: This app is great at displaying tweets on Android wear. By far the best I've seen so far. Much better than the few other twitter apps I've tried for Wear.  A few features that would really help: - An option to disable/enable notifications. I don't always want my watch vibrating to alert me of new tweets throughout the day. There are only particular times I will likely want to use this and the constant vibrates for new tweets throughout the day is a bit annoying. - Some way to fetch the latest tweets. Not sure if this is done in the background, but would be nice if this could be triggered via wear. - Some way to favorite tweets for later. Sometimes there are links/videos I'll want to watch on my phone. Would be nice if that could be done via this app.
title: Great at displaying tweets
